articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Hong Song Nam
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Wednesday sent a wreath to the bier of the late Hong Song Nam, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and concurrently alternate member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Hong Song Nam Dies
articles.content:
Hong Song Nam Dies
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and concurrently alternate member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, died of uremic myocardiopathy at the age of 79 on March 31 to our sorrow.
					 He was born in a poor peasant family in Jongju City, North Phyongan Province on October 2, Juche 18 (1929). After the liberation of the country he grew up to be an able official under the care of President Kim Il Sung. During the Fatherland Liberation War he protected the Party and the leader politically and ideologically at the risk of his life with arms in hand. In the period of socialist construction he contributed to developing the heavy industry and cementing the foundation of the independent national economy, holding responsible posts at the Central Committee of the WPK and the Cabinet. 
					
					 He worked as vice department director and department director of the WPK Central Committee from 1964, as vice-premier of the Administration Council and concurrently chairman of the State Planning Commission from 1973, as first vice-premier of the Administration Council from 1986, as premier of the Cabinet from 1998 and as chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK from 2003. 
					
					 He worked as member of the WPK Central Committee from 1971 and alternate member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee from 1982. 
					
					 He had been deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly since the 7th SPA in 1982.
					
					 He was awarded the Order of Kim Il Sung, the highest order of the DPRK, the Order of the National Flag 1st Class and many other state citations in recognition of his distinguished feats performed for the Party and the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					 On the same day, an obituary of Hong Song Nam was issued in the joint name of the WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
					
					 According to the obituary, he was a revolutionary soldier loyal to the WPK who devoted himself to the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche true to the leadership of the Party and the leader. The exploits performed by him for the Party and the revolution, the country and the people will always be remembered by them, it noted. 
					
					 The WPK Central Committee and the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly announced that the late Hong Song Nam would be accorded a state funeral and formed a state funeral committee with Kim Yong Nam as its chairman and Jo Myong Rok and 34 others as its members. 
					
					 The committee issued a notice that his coffin would be placed in the Sojang Hall in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang and it would receive condolers from 3 p.m. to 8 p.m. on April 1 and the coffin would be carried out of the hall at 8 a.m. on April 2.

articles.title: Condolences Expressed over Death of Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Condolences Expressed over Death of Hong Song Nam
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and working people from all walks of life Wednesday visited the bier of the late Hong Song Nam, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and concurrently alternate member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, to express deep condolences over his death. 
					Seen standing by the side of the bier of the deceased was a wreath sent by General Secretary
						Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths from the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the SPA and the Cabinet of the DPRK, armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, Party and power organs in Pyongyang and South Hamgyong Province. 
					
					 Officials of the Party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, officials of local party and power organs and working people from all walks of life visited the bier to express condolences over Hong's death. 
					
					 The condolers paid silent tribute to the late Hong and expressed deep condolences to the bereaved family. 
					
					 That day the diplomatic corps and representatives of international organizations here and overseas compatriots staying in the homeland visited the bier to express condolences over Hong's death. 
					
					 The diplomatic corps and representatives of international organizations here placed a wreath on behalf of the diplomatic corps and paid silent tribute to the deceased.

articles.title: New School Year Begins in DPRK
articles.content:
New School Year Begins in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A new school year has begun in the DPRK.
					 Ceremonies to start the school year took place at universities and middle and primary schools across the country on Wednesday. 
					
					 Officials of Party and power organs at all levels, teachers, students and their parents warmly congratulated the new comers entering campus with flowers on their chests. 
					
					 Reports and speeches were made at the ceremonies.
					
					 The ceremonies were followed by the first lessons of the new school year.

articles.title: Affection for Posterity
articles.content:
Affection for Posterity
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Opening ceremonies for the new school year for Juche 98 (2009) which begins on April 1 were held at all schools throughout the DPRK.
					 Incoming students, their parents, teaching staffs and students are keenly realizing the love shown by the peerlessly great persons for the rising generations.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung saw to it that Children's Corps schools were built in the guerrilla bases in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. Many policies enforced for the children after the liberation of the country were also associated with such love and benevolence of the President.
					
					 The problem of pencil production for the children was placed on the first agenda of the Provisional People's Committee of North Korea. The universal 11-year compulsory education is now in force, under which the young people study to their hearts' content without paying a penny.
					
					 The children are bringing their hope into bloom in the children's palaces and children's halls established in Pyongyang, Kaesong, Samjiyon and other parts of the country.
					
					 There are many legend-like stories about branch schools for a few pupils in solitary islets far from the land and remote mountainous villages and about school trains, buses and boats.
					
					 The schools of the country never ceased their operation even in the period of the "Arduous March" and forced march.
					
					 Vans, called "king's" cars, run streets every day, carrying bean milk.
					
					 Children's camps were built in seashores and beauty spots.
					
					 The children of the DPRK, "king" of the country, are growing up stoutly as successors to the revolution and reliable reserves for the construction of a great, prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: Spring Tree Planting Brisk across Country
articles.content:
Spring Tree Planting Brisk across Country
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Spring tree planting is making brisk headway in the DPRK.
					 Tall trees and flower plants of various species have been planted in the arboretum of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the highest temple of Juche, and the Munsubong Revolutionary Site and other revolutionary sites associated with the traces of the leadership provided by the peerlessly great persons.
					
					 Recreation grounds, parks and streets of Pyongyang and residential quarters are alive with tree planting. 
					
					Nearly 50,000 trees including Pyongyang maple tree, zelkova tree and chestnut tree have been planted by employees of ministries and national institutions recently.
					
					 Lots of trees and flower plants including pine-nut tree and azalea were planted in Mansudae Street where reconstruction projects are making progress on a vertical expansion basis and many other places of the city.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province planted 50 million trees in March. The cities and counties of North Hwanghae Province, Kangwon Province, South Hamgyong Province, North Hamgyong Province and South Phyongan Province are also speeding up the tree planting.

articles.title: Sea Bird Sanctuaries in North Phyongan Province
articles.content:
Sea Bird Sanctuaries in North Phyongan Province
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- There are many sea bird sanctuaries on the coast of North Phyongan Province.
					 Flocks of such sea birds as blackfaced spoonbill, yellow-beaked white heron and gull inhabit the sea bird sanctuaries on Taegam Islet, Kwaksan County.
					
					 The blackfaced spoonbill lays 4 to 6 eggs in March and flies away to the wintering site in October or November.
					
					 Tens of thousands of gulls always flock the seabird breeding site on Rap Islet off Sonchon County. 
					
					 Mounds of gull eggs spread a spectacular scene there in May and June.
					
					 There is a yellow-beaked white heron breeding site on Muki Islet far to the southwest of Sinmi Island.
					
					 Various species of sea birds are propagating in the sea-bird breeding site on Chamcha Islet and sea-bird sanctuary on Unmu Islet.
					
					 Chamcha Islet is a spring and summer intensive breeding site of such sea birds as gulls and shearwater.
					
					 The DPRK registered these areas as sea-bird sanctuaries long ago and has shown deep care for them.

articles.title: Meeting of Co-chairmen of Pomchonghakryon Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Co-chairmen of Pomchonghakryon Held
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The 19th meeting of co-chairmen of the north, south and overseas sides to the Pan-national Alliance of Youth and Students for Korea's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) was held on March 31 by way of exchanging facsimile messages. 
					 The meeting reviewed the work done by Pomchonghakryon last year and discussed an action orientation and tasks for this year.
					
					 A report was made at the meeting.
					
					 The report referred to the fact that last year Pomchonghakryon properly saw through the nature of the Lee Myung Bak conservative ruling forces and disclosed their true colors in time and joined all members of the nation in courageously waging the anti-U.S., anti-Lee Myung Bak struggle. 
					
					 The report noted that the organization waged a dynamic movement to embody the spirit of "By our nation itself" in all its activities, regarding the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration as signposts for reunification. 
					
					 The report proposed tasks to be fulfilled by Pomchonghakryon to energetically intensify the patriotic movement for national reunification for the purpose of firmly upholding and sincerely implementing the historic north-south joint declarations this year.
					
					 The report set the period from June 15 to October 4 as the "period of the youth and students movement for implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration" and stressed the need to wage an intensive mass movement for implementing the declarations.
					
					 Pomchonghakryon should take the lead in the struggle to resolutely frustrate the traitorous and anti-reunification idea and war moves of the conservative ruling forces, get all the fascist laws including the "National Security Law" repealed and have the reunification movement organizations legalized, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Pomchonghakryon should fully support the struggle of the overseas headquarters against the behavior of the Japanese authorities violating the rights of Koreans in Japan and trampling down upon their national dignity, in particular, and briskly conduct multifarious activities including the movement to defend Tok Islet. 
					
					 The report underlined the need for Pomchonghakryon to channel primary efforts into education, information service and the work to strengthen the organization and boost solidarity with different circles and organizations and the solidarity among the north, south and overseas sides in order to launch a dynamic struggle against the evermore undisguised moves of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad to escalate confrontation with compatriots and their fascist suppression. 
					
					 A joint resolution was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: U.S. Moves for Building Missile Defense System Flailed
articles.content:
U.S. Moves for Building Missile Defense System Flailed
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. bellicose forces conducted an anti-missile test at a base in Kawai of Hawaii, the first of its kind since the emergence of the new U.S. administration. The U.S. moves for establishing the missile defense system (MD) is a product of the U.S. hegemonic policy and a root cause of a new arms race. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is needless to say that if the U.S. moves for MD are pushed forward in real earnest, when taking into consideration the present possession of nuclear and strategic weapons in the world, it will result in upsetting the military strategic equilibrium and stability in the world and spark and escalate a new global arms race by getting on the nerves of various countries. 
					
					 Russia and China have already clarified their stands that they would be compelled to take corresponding measures in case the U.S. goes ahead with the building of MD. This has aroused concern over it even among the U.S. allies. 
					
					 When the situation reached such a pass, the U.S. has become more vociferous about the DPRK's non-existent "missile threat" and taken an option to step up its moves to establish MD, justifying those moves and the escalation of its arms race. 
					
					 As a matter of fact it is the DPRK that is exposed to constant missile threat. The U.S. is posing a missile threat to the DPRK and the latter is its victim.
					
					 A basic aim sought by the U.S. in putting spurs to the moves for establishing MD while spreading the rumor about "missile threat from north Korea" like a thief crying "Stop the thief!" is to throw a missile network worldwide in a bid to ensure an unchallenged military strategic edge and neutralize the military deterrents of other countries and carry out its strategy for world domination.
					
					 It is a pipedream of the U.S. to dominate the world by force. 
					
					The U.S. would be well advised to drop its anachronistic Cold War-minded way of thinking and ambition and stop the rash acts to increase the danger of arms race.

articles.title: Absurd Assertion over DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch Refuted
articles.content:
Absurd Assertion over DPRK's Projected Satellite Launch Refuted
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- There is an absurd assertion in the international arena these days that in case the DPRK launches a satellite, it should be taken up by the UN Security Council as it disturbs the regional peace and stability. This is a silly talk absolutely unacceptable to anyone. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says this in its signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK is a sovereign state with an equal independent right with other countries and a full-fledged member state of the UN. To pull up the DPRK over its satellite launch is a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK and a serious insult to its dignity. 
					
					 If the UNSC takes up the above-said issue at the prodding of the U.S. and its followers, it will either leave only a disgraceful stain on its history or reveal itself before the whole world that it is no more than a puppet mechanism controlled by specified states. 
					
					 The outcries made by such countries as the United States and Japan, describing the above-said issue as a sort of serious development, are intended to make crafty use of the UN for achieving their ulterior political purpose. 
					
					 These countries stand in the way of any project when they see it contradictory to their interests regardless of whether it pertains to the independent rights of a sovereign state or whether it is a just and aboveboard one guaranteed by international law. 
					
					 This is precisely the reason why they are creating such a complicated situation surrounding the DPRK's projected space development, an opportunity given to each sovereign state, blustering that only the DPRK should not be allowed to do so. 
					
					 Taking issue with the DPRK's satellite launch diametrically runs counter to the spirit of the September 19 joint statement. 
					
					 Therefore, the discussion of the above-said issue by the UNSC itself would mean the collapse of the six-party talks and everything achieved until now in the process for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula come to naught. 
					
					 If the UNSC takes up the above-said matter defying all the adverse consequences, the responsibility for them will entirely rest with the UN and other countries involved in the lobbying to refer it to the UNSC, warns the commentary.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Ambition to Invade North Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Ambition to Invade North Flayed
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is now mulling its full participation in the PSI, absurdly asserting that the DPRK's projected satellite launch is a "missile launch" and "it uses the same technology as involved in WMDs." This is nothing but a revelation of its plan to realize its ambition to invade the north by tightening the nexus with foreign forces under the pretext of the DPRK's satellite launch.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK has ardently wished to advance into space for peaceful purposes, swimming with the international trend of space exploration.  This time it opened the projected satellite launch to the public and sent necessary information to the relevant international organizations.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the south Korean authorities took the lead in crying out for "sanctions" and "pressure" through international cooperation,  persistently insisting that the DPRK's projected satellite launch is a "missile launch" though it is for peaceful purposes. 
					
					 Even today when their master flinches, overawed by the principled attitude of the DPRK, they are going mad with a malignant smear campaign against it and confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the Lee group is, indeed, a group of traitors going reckless in the confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 The DPRK will never tolerate the group's reckless moves to disturb the peace on the Korean Peninsula as it loves the peace more than any others.
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to behave itself, bearing in mind that its move to fully participate in the PSI is as foolish an act as precipitating its self-destruction.

articles.title: Glorification of President Kim Il Sung's Exploits Called for
articles.content:
Glorification of President Kim Il Sung's Exploits Called for
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Leading newspapers Wednesday editorially say that the revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung is shining as the history of a peerlessly great man who performed immortal exploits for the country and people, regarding the building of a socialist power as his lifelong mission. They call for eternally glorifying his feats performed in building a rich and powerful country.
					 Rodong Sinmun says that the exploits performed by the President in building a rich and powerful nation are throwing rays as eternal treasures which guarantee the permanent victory and prosperity of the country.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					The President's cause of building a rich and powerful nation is now being successfully carried out under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is the unshakable resolution of the Workers' Party of Korea to surely open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of the President, by relying on the powerful political and military potentials built in the crucible of the Songun revolution and the indomitable mental power of the army and people of the DPRK.
					
					 It is necessary to accelerate the on-going general offensive, regarding the immortal exploits performed by the President for the building of a rich and powerful nation all his life as a lifeline.
					
					 We should never forget the undying exploits the President performed by building a power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, on this land where backwardness and poverty once prevailed no matter how much water has flowed under the bridge and making the country widely known as "Chollima Korea" and "heroic Korea." 
					
					 It is imperative to push forward the revolution and construction the way the President did, considering his revolutionary idea, the Juche idea as guidelines for life and struggle.
					
					 A great leap forward should be effected on all fronts of socialist construction as it was done in the period of great Chollima surge in the post-war days. 
					
					 It is necessary to sound the general advance on all fronts under the uplifted revolutionary banner of self-reliance provided by the President in the crucible of the anti-Japanese struggle.
					
					 Sure to triumph is the drive for building a Juche-oriented great prosperous and powerful socialist nation as there are an eternal cornerstone for building a rich and powerful nation provided by the President all his life and the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Minju Joson calls for accomplishing the President's cause of building a rich and powerful nation by intensifying the drive for effecting a new great revolutionary surge.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Moves to Put Media under Their Control Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Moves to Put Media under Their Control Flayed
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Federation for Democratic Media of south Korea issued a statement on March 27 denouncing the present "government" and the ruling party for their undisguised moves to put broadcasting services and other media under their control.
					 The statement accused the Lee "government" of letting a large number of his confidants hold responsible posts at Yonhap TV News and other media organizations and their related institutions. It deplored that the media persons of conscience are fired for chiding the "government" policies and even thrown behind bars. 
					
					 The statement declared the organization would struggle against the authorities' moves to grant even the right to manage broadcasting services to the conservative media and big businesses under the pretext of increasing employment in a bid to put them under their control.

articles.title: Honorary Citizenship Awarded to Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Honorary Citizenship Awarded to Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Pampas District Office of Tayacaja City, Huancavelica Province, Peru decided to award honorary citizenship to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 A ceremony was held in the above-said district on Mar.18 to convey the decision on awarding honorary citizenship to the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The decision said: Prompted by the political will to strengthen the friendly relations with all the people of the world, the countries which boast time-honored history in particular, we pay tribute to the outstanding commanders of the Korean people and have the pleasure to register them as honorary citizens as they firmly protected the sovereignty of the DPRK and paid deep attention to the cultural exchange with Pampas District, Tayacaja City, Huancavelica Province.
					
					 The decision was conveyed to an official of the DPRK embassy at the ceremony.
					
					 The mayor of the city who doubles as the governor of the district, conveying the decision, said that it is the immense honor and exceptionally high pride for the inhabitants of Pampas District to hold in esteem Kim Il Sung, eternal President of the DPRK, and Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk as honorary citizens of their city, adding that he would make positive efforts to boost the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: DPRK's Satellite Launch Supported by Russian Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Satellite Launch Supported by Russian Organization
Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Executive Committee of the Movement for Supporting the Policies of the President of the Russian Federation issued a statement on March 27 in support of the DPRK's plan for developing space for peaceful purposes.
					 Recalling that Western media are now kicking up much fuss over the issue of the DPRK's projected launch of experimental communications satellite, the statement noted that their basic purpose is to deter the DPRK's development of space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 No one can bar a sovereign state from conducting a scientific experiment in any scientific and technological field including ultra-modern technology.
					
					 The DPRK, a sovereign state, has a plan to develop space necessary for the nation's economic development and the promotion of the welfare of the people in a few years to come.
					
					 The DPRK has the right to defend itself and ensure its security as a driving force under international law.
					
					 The executive committee supports the DPRK's projected satellite launch and wishes it success and calls on all the progressive forces in the world to spare no efforts to prevent the provocative acts and the escalation of the tension on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Hong Song Nam
  Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente   Kim Jong Il envio el dia primero la ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Hong Song Nam, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur,  en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Fallecio Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Fallecio Hong Song Nam
 Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- El secretario responsable del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Hong Song Nam, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fallecio el 31 de marzo a pesar nuestro a los 79 anos de edad  a consecuencia del obstaculo de miocardio uremico.
					  Hong nacio el 2 de octubre del 18 (1929) de la Era Juche en la familia de un campesino pobre de la ciudad de Jongju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte. Despues de la liberacion de la patria crecio como funcionario talentoso en el regazo del Presidente Kim Il Sung. En el periodo de la guerra de liberacion de la patria (1950-1950) defendio en lo politico e ideologico y a costa de la vida al partido y el lider al tomar el arma en su mano, en el periodo de la construccion socialista trabajo en los cargos responsables del Comite Central del PTC y del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y contribuyo a desarrollar la industria pesada y echar la firme base de la economia nacional independiente.
					
					  El trabajo desde 1964 de subjefe y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, a partir de 1973 de vicepremier del Consejo de Administracion y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion, desde 1986 de primer vicepremier del Consejo de Administracion, a partir de 1998 de premier del Consejo de Ministros y desde 2003 de secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					  Trabajo desde 1971 de miembro del CC del PTC y a partir de 1982 de miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC.
					
					  Hong fue electo como diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema a partir de la septima legislatura de la APS del 1982.
					
					  Le fueron impuestos numerosos premios estatales incluyendo la "Orden Kim Il Sung", distincion suprema de la RPDC y la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase, en virtud de sus extraordinarias proezas realizadas ante el partido y la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					  El dia 31 fue publicada la necrologia a nombre comun del CC del PTC y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					   El documento senala que Hong fue un soldado revolucionario fiel al PTC quien dedico todo lo suyo por el cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche y subraya que quedaran eternamente sus proezas acumuladas para el partido y  la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo.
					
					  El CC del PTC y el Presidium de la APS de la RPDC anunciaron que los funerales del difunto Hong Song Nam se realizaran a cargo del Estado y compusieron la comision de funerales del Estado con  Kim Yong Nam como presidente y con  Jo Myong Rok y  otras 34 personas como miembros.
					
					　La comision de funerales informo de que el feretro del difundo se pone en el Club de Sojang del capitalino municipio de Pothonggang y que recibira desde las 15 hasta las 20 del dia primero a los huespedes de duelo que vienen a despedir al difunto.
					
					  Igualmente, notifico que el  traslado del feretro del difundo tendra lugar  a las 8 del dia 2.

articles.title: Expresan condolencias al difunto Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Expresan condolencias al difunto Hong Song Nam
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- Los funcionarios de los organos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, entidades de masas, ministerios y organismos centrales, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y trabajadores de distintos sectores expresaron el dia primero profundas condolencias al feretro del difunto Hong Song Nam, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Sur con motivo de su fallecimiento.
					  Estaban puestas al lado del feretro la ofrenda floral envida por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y las otras despachadas por el Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, las instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, entidades de masas, ministerios, organismos centrales y establecimientos del partido y el Poder en la ciudad de Pyongyang y la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur.
					
					  Visitaron por condolencia los funcionarios de los organos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, entidades de masas, ministerios y organismos centrales, oficiales y soldados del EPC, los funcionarios de los organos locales del partido y el Poder y trabajadores de distintos sectores, quienes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto y expresaron profundas condolencias a los familiares del difunto.
					
					  Ese dia, hicieron lo mismo el Cuerpo Diplomatico, los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales acreditados en Corea y los compatriotas en ultramar quienes permanecen en la patria.
					
					  Los extranjeros guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto tras depositar la ofrenda floral en nombre del Cuerpo Diplomatico.

articles.title: Se inicia nuevo ano escolar de 2009
articles.content:
Se inicia nuevo ano escolar de 2009
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ATCC) -- Hoy se inicio el nuevo curso escolar del 98 (2009) de la Era Juche en las universidades y escuelas segundarias y primarias de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Los funcionarios de los organos del partido y el Poder a todos los niveles, maestros, empleados y alumnos de las escuelas y padres felicitaron ardientemente a los principiantes quienes entran en los planteles docentes prendiendo una flor en el pecho.
					
					  En los actos de inicio del nuevo ano escolar hubo informes y discursos.
					
					  Luego, tuvieron lugar primeras lecciones del nuevo ano escolar.
